"Me?  Well, the Rogues got started when I, a Predacon at the time, 
met a Maximal named Devilcat." Gatara says, rather bluntly.  "He was 
a visionary; he looked past the political doublespeak the Maximal 
Elders and Tripredacus Council spouted both at each other and the 
citizenry, and he saw the uselessness of it all.  So we broke off - 
formed our own society, our own way of life.  Naturally, the 
aforementioned councils branded us as criminals the instant they 
learned what we'd done.  But it was too late, and we started picking 
up recruits from all over the place.  We got established as more than 
just a fringe group when we latched onto an old pleasure cruiser and 
retrofitted it to this - the Rogue Star."  She indicates their 
current surroundings.  "We travelled far and wide, limited only by 
our own imaginations when we chose our destinations.  We met several 
alien races, and managed to incorporate their technology into what we 
already had.  One of these called themselves the Shyft - that's where 
we got our lovely little dissapearing act.  Now, how about you - I 
imagine there's more to your story then just coming here out of thin 
air looking for a friend."

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil follows and seats himself on the rather small chair. He 
was 
> not the kind to like games though, so he did not touch the commands.
> 
> Yggdrasil: What about you? How did you join up with the others?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Gatara laughs.  "Of course we're not!  Some of us used to be 
> > Predacons, some were Maximals - but no longer.  We follow our own 
> > rules, march to our own drum."
> > 
> > She leads her companion into Rogue Star's recreation area.  
Gatara 
> > plunks herself down at a table with a holo-projector built in for 
> > games and the like.  "Have a seat.  It's been a while since I've 
had 
> > a chance to talk with someone from my own weight class."
